data:
## function_bindableDerived
> **bindableDerived**\<`T`, `U`\>(`onChange$`, `stores`, `adjustValue`, `equal`): [`WritableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/WritableSignal.html)\<`T`, `T`\>

Creates a writable signal that derives its value from multiple stores and allows for custom adjustment and equality checks.

### Type Parameters

• **T**

The type of the derived value.

• **U** *extends* [[`WritableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/WritableSignal.html)\<`T`, `T`\>, `...StoreInput<any>[]`]

A tuple type where the first element is a writable signal of type T and the rest are store inputs.

### Parameters

• **onChange$**: [`ReadableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/ReadableSignal.html)\<(`value`) => `void`\>

A readable signal that emits a function to be called when the derived value changes.

• **stores**: `U`

A tuple of stores where the first element is a writable signal of type T and the rest are store inputs.

• **adjustValue** = `...`

A function to adjust the derived value based on the input values from the stores.

• **equal** = `...`

A function to compare the current and new values for equality.

### Returns

[`WritableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/WritableSignal.html)\<`T`, `T`\>

A writable signal that derives its value from the provided stores and allows for custom adjustment and equality checks.

## function_bindableProp
> **bindableProp**\<`T`\>(`store$`, `onChange$`, `adjustValue`?, `equal`?): [`WritableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/WritableSignal.html)\<`T`, `T`\>

Creates a bindable property that synchronizes a writable signal with an optional adjustment function and equality check.

### Type Parameters

• **T**

The type of the value being stored.

### Parameters

• **store$**: [`WritableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/WritableSignal.html)\<`T`, `undefined` \| `T`\>

The writable signal that holds the current value.

• **onChange$**: [`ReadableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/ReadableSignal.html)\<(`newValue`) => `void`\>

A readable signal that triggers a callback when the value changes.

• **adjustValue?** = `identity`

An optional function to adjust the value before storing it. Defaults to the identity function.

• **equal?** = `tansuDefaultEqual`

An optional function to compare values for equality. Defaults to `tansuDefaultEqual`.

### Returns

[`WritableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/WritableSignal.html)\<`T`, `T`\>

A writable signal that synchronizes with the provided store and triggers the onChange callback when updated.

## function_createPatch
> **createPatch**\<`T`\>(`stores`): (`storesValues`) => `void`

Utility function designed to create a `patch` function related to the provided stores.
Any key given to the patch function which is not in the original object will be ignored.

### Type Parameters

• **T** *extends* `object`

The type of the object that the stores represent.

### Parameters

• **stores**: [`ToWritableSignal`](#towritablesignal)\<`T`\>

The stores to be updated.

### Returns

`Function`

- A function that takes partial values of the stores and updates them.

#### Parameters

• **storesValues**: [`Partial`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#partialtype)\<`T`\>

#### Returns

`void`

### Example

```typescript
const storeA$ = writable(1);
const storeB$ = writable(1);
const patch = createPatch({a: storeA$, b: storeB$});

patch({a: 2}) // will perform storeA$.set(2)
patch({a: 2, b: 2}) // will perform storeA$.set(2) and storeB$.set(2) in the same batch.
patch({a: 2, c: 2}) // will perform storeA$.set(2), c is ignored.

```

## function_findChangedProperties
> **findChangedProperties**\<`T`\>(`obj1`, `obj2`): [`Partial`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#partialtype)\<`T`\> \| `null`

This utility function is designed to compare the first level of two objects.

It returns a new object which has all the keys for which the values in `obj1`
and `obj2` are different, with the values from `obj2`, or null if objects
are identical.

### Type Parameters

• **T** *extends* [`Record`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#recordkeys-type)\<`string`, `any`\>

The type of the objects being compared.

### Parameters

• **obj1**: [`Partial`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#partialtype)\<`T`\>

The first partial object to compare.

• **obj2**: [`Partial`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#partialtype)\<`T`\>

The second partial object to compare.

### Returns

[`Partial`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#partialtype)\<`T`\> \| `null`

A partial object containing the properties that have different values, or `null` if the objects are identical.

## function_isStore
> **isStore**(`x`): `x is ReadableSignal<any>`

Returns true if the provided argument is a store (ReadableSignal).

### Parameters

• **x**: `any`

argument that is tested

### Returns

`x is ReadableSignal<any>`

true if the argument is a store (ReadableSignal)

## function_mergeConfigStores
> **mergeConfigStores**\<`T`\>(`keys`, `config1`?, `config2`?): [`ReadableSignals`](#readablesignals)\<`T`\>

Merges two configuration stores into one, prioritizing the first store's values
when both stores have a value for the same key.

### Type Parameters

• **T** *extends* `object`

The type of the configuration object.

### Parameters

• **keys**: keyof `T`[]

The keys to merge from the configuration stores.

• **config1?**: [`ReadableSignals`](#readablesignals)\<`T`\>

The first configuration store.

• **config2?**: [`ReadableSignals`](#readablesignals)\<`T`\>

The second configuration store.

### Returns

[`ReadableSignals`](#readablesignals)\<`T`\>

- The merged configuration store.

## function_normalizeConfigStores
> **normalizeConfigStores**\<`T`\>(`keys`, `config`?): [`ReadableSignals`](#readablesignals)\<`T`\>

Normalizes configuration stores by converting them into readable signals.

### Type Parameters

• **T** *extends* `object`

The type of the configuration object.

### Parameters

• **keys**: keyof `T`[]

An array of keys to normalize from the configuration object.

• **config?**: [`ReadableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/ReadableSignal.html)\<[`Partial`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#partialtype)\<`T`\>\> \| [`ValuesOrReadableSignals`](../types#valuesorreadablesignals)\<`T`\>

The configuration object or readable signals to normalize.

### Returns

[`ReadableSignals`](#readablesignals)\<`T`\>

An object containing readable signals for each key in the configuration.

## type alias_ReadableSignals
> **ReadableSignals**\<`T`\>: \{ \[K in keyof T\]?: ReadableSignal\<T\[K\] \| undefined\> \}

Represents a collection of readable signals for an object type `T`.
Each key in the object corresponds to a key in `T`, and the value is an optional `ReadableSignal`
that can hold the value of the corresponding property in `T` or `undefined`.

### Type Parameters

• **T** *extends* `object`

The object type for which the readable signals are defined.

## function_stateStores
> **stateStores**\<`A`\>(`inputStores`): `object`

Using input stores, this function builds an object containing the stores as readable and a global state.

### Type Parameters

• **A** *extends* `object`

The type of the state object.

### Parameters

• **inputStores**: \{ \[K in string \| number \| symbol as \`$\{K & string\}$\`\]: ReadableSignal\<any\> \}

the input stores

### Returns

`object`

the object containing the stores as readable and the global state

#### state$

> **state$**: [`ReadableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/ReadableSignal.html)\<`A`\>

#### stores

> **stores**: \{ \[K in string \| number \| symbol as \`$\{K & string\}$\`\]: ReadableSignal\<A\[K\]\> \}

## function_toReadableStore
> **toReadableStore**\<`T`\>(`x`): [`ReadableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/ReadableSignal.html)\<`T`\>

If the provided argument is already a store, it is returned as is, otherwise, a readable store is created with the provided argument as its initial value.

### Type Parameters

• **T**

The type of the value.

### Parameters

• **x**: `T` \| [`ReadableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/ReadableSignal.html)\<`T`\>

The value to be converted to a readable store.

### Returns

[`ReadableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/ReadableSignal.html)\<`T`\>

- The readable store containing the value.

## type alias_ToWritableSignal
> **ToWritableSignal**\<`P`\>: \{ \[K in keyof P as \`$\{K & string\}$\`\]-?: WritableSignal\<P\[K\], P\[K\] \| undefined\> \}

Transforms the properties of a given type `P` into writable signals.
Each property key in `P` is suffixed with a `$` and its type is converted to a `WritableSignal`.

### Type Parameters

• **P**

The original type whose properties are to be transformed.

## function_toWritableStore
> **toWritableStore**\<`T`\>(`x`): [`WritableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/WritableSignal.html)\<`T`, `T`\>

Converts a value or a writable signal into a writable signal.

### Type Parameters

• **T**

The type of the value or signal.

### Parameters

• **x**: `T` \| [`WritableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/WritableSignal.html)\<`T`, `T`\>

The value or writable signal to convert.

### Returns

[`WritableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/WritableSignal.html)\<`T`, `T`\>

- The resulting writable signal.

## function_useObservable
> **useObservable**\<`T`\>(`store$`): `T`

Observe a readable store inside of a react component.

### Type Parameters

• **T**

The type of the value emitted by the ReadableSignal.

### Parameters

• **store$**: [`ReadableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/ReadableSignal.html)\<`T`\>

the readable store

### Returns

`T`

the observed value of the store

## function_useObservablesProxy
> **useObservablesProxy**\<`State`\>(`stores`): `State`

Hook to create a proxy object that subscribes to observable stores and triggers re-renders on updates.

### Type Parameters

• **State**

The shape of the state object.

### Parameters

• **stores**: \{ \[K in string as \`$\{K\}$\`\]: ReadableSignal\<State\[K\]\> \}

An object where keys are suffixed with `$` and values are readable signals.

### Returns

`State`

- A proxy object that reflects the current state of the observables.

## function_usePropsAsStore
> **usePropsAsStore**\<`T`\>(`props`?): [`ReadableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/ReadableSignal.html)\<[`Partial`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#partialtype)\<`T`\>\>

Turn react props into readable stores.

### Type Parameters

• **T** *extends* `object`

The type of the props object.

### Parameters

• **props?**: [`Partial`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#partialtype)\<`T`\>

the props

### Returns

[`ReadableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/ReadableSignal.html)\<[`Partial`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#partialtype)\<`T`\>\>

the readable stores

## type alias_WithoutDollar
> **WithoutDollar**\<`S`\>: `S` *extends* \`$\{infer U\}$\` ? `U` : `never`

A utility type that removes the trailing dollar sign (`$`) from a string type.

### Type Parameters

• **S** *extends* \`$\{string\}$\`

A string type that ends with a dollar sign (`$`).

### Returns

The string type without the trailing dollar sign (`$`), or `never` if the input type does not end with a dollar sign.

## function_writablesForProps
> **writablesForProps**\<`T`\>(`defConfig`, `propsConfig`?, `options`?): [[`ToWritableSignal`](#towritablesignal)\<`T`\>, (`storesValues`) => `void`]

Shortcut for calling both [writablesWithDefault](#writableswithdefault) and [createPatch](#createpatch) in one call.

### Type Parameters

• **T** *extends* `object`

The type of the properties configuration object.

### Parameters

• **defConfig**: `T`

object containing, for each property, a default value to use in case `config` does not provide the suitable default
value for that property

• **propsConfig?**: [`PropsConfig`](../types#propsconfig)\<`T`\>

either a store of objects containing, for each property of `defConfig`, the default value or an object containing
for each property of `defConfig` either a store containing the default value or the default value itself

• **options?**: \{ \[K in string \| number \| symbol\]: undefined \| WritableWithDefaultOptions\<T\[K\]\> \}

object containing, for each property of `defConfig`, an optional object with the following optional functions: normalizeValue and equal

### Returns

[[`ToWritableSignal`](#towritablesignal)\<`T`\>, (`storesValues`) => `void`]

an array with two items: the first one containing the writables (returned by [writablesWithDefault](#writableswithdefault)),
and the second one containing the patch function (returned by [createPatch](#createpatch))

### Examples

```ts
const defConfig = {propA: 1};
const validation = {propA: {normalizeValue: value => +value}};
const config$ = writable({propA: 5});
const [{propA$}, patch] = writablesForProps(defConfig, config$, validation);
```

```ts
const defConfig = {propA: 1, propB: 2};
const validation = {propA: {normalizeValue: value => +value}};
const config = {propA: 5, propB: writable(3)};
const [{propA$, propB$}, patch] = writablesForProps(defConfig, config, validation);
```

## function_writablesWithDefault
> **writablesWithDefault**\<`T`\>(`defConfig`, `propsConfig`?, `options`?): [`ToWritableSignal`](#towritablesignal)\<`T`\>

Returns an object containing, for each property of `defConfig`, a corresponding writable with the normalization and default value logic
described in [writableWithDefault](#writablewithdefault). Keys in the returned object are the same as the ones present in `defConfig`,
with the exta `$` suffix (showing that they are stores).

### Type Parameters

• **T** *extends* `object`

The type of the default configuration object.

### Parameters

• **defConfig**: `T`

object containing, for each property, a default value to use in case `config$` does not provide the suitable default
value for that property

• **propsConfig?**: [`PropsConfig`](../types#propsconfig)\<`T`\>

object defining the config and props

• **options?**: [`ConfigValidator`](../types#configvalidator)\<`T`\>

object containing, for each property of `defConfig`, an optional object with the following optional functions: normalizeValue and equal

### Returns

[`ToWritableSignal`](#towritablesignal)\<`T`\>

an object containing writables

### Examples

```ts
const defConfig = {propA: 1};
const validation = {propA: {normalizeValue: value => +value}};
const config = writable({propA: 5});
const {propA$} = writablesWithDefault(defConfig, {config}, validation);
```

```ts
const defConfig = {propA: 1, propB: 2};
const validation = {propA: {normalizeValue: value => +value}};
const config = {propA: 5, propB: writable(3)};
const {propA$, propB$} = writablesWithDefault(defConfig, {config}, validation);
```

## function_writableWithDefault
> **writableWithDefault**\<`T`\>(`defValue`, `config$`, `options`, `own$`): [`WritableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/WritableSignal.html)\<`T`, `T` \| `undefined`\>

Returns a writable store whose value is either its own value (when it is not undefined) or a default value
that comes either from the `config$` store (when it is not undefined) or from `defValue`.
If a normalizeValue function is passed in the options, it is called to normalize non-undefined values coming
either from the `config$` store or from the `set` or `update` functions. If a value is invalid (i.e. normalizeValue
returns the `invalidValue` symbol), an error is logged on the console and it is either not set (if it comes from the
`set` or `update` functions), or the `defValue` is used instead (if the invalid value comes from the `config$` store).

### Type Parameters

• **T**

The type of the value.

### Parameters

• **defValue**: `T`

Default value used when both the own value and the config$ value are undefined.

• **config$**: [`ReadableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/ReadableSignal.html)\<`undefined` \| `T`\> = `...`

Store containing the default value used when the own value is undefined

• **options**: [`WritableWithDefaultOptions`](../types#writablewithdefaultoptions)\<`T`\> = `{}`

Object which can contain the following optional functions: normalizeValue and equal

• **own$**: [`WritableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/WritableSignal.html)\<`undefined` \| `T`, `undefined` \| `T`\> = `...`

Store containing the own value

### Returns

[`WritableSignal`](https://amadeusitgroup.github.io/tansu/interfaces/WritableSignal.html)\<`T`, `T` \| `undefined`\>

a writable store with the extra default value and normalization logic described above
